maml:description.maml:para: Sign Out a user from all CyberArk Identity sessions everywhere.

Invalidates all sessions for a user. All the sessions and cookies present for that user will be deleted and user needs to be login again. Only system administrator, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
The unique ID (Uuid) of the user to sign out.
The unique ID (Uuid) of the user to sign out.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Signs out user with Uuid of "abc-1234-def-5678-ghi-90-jkl"

maml:description.maml:para: Logout the current user
Logout the current user

dev:remarks.maml:para: Logout the current user

maml:description.maml:para: Get all datasets accessible to user
Lists the following:
All custom datasets created by one user All default datasets available to all users in the tenant for CyberArk User Behaviour Analytics Service.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns any accessible datasets

maml:description.maml:para: Get Connector Status
Retrieve health status of all connectors, or specific connector
The ID of the cloud connector to check
The ID of the cloud connector to check

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get status of all connectors
Get status of specific connectors

maml:description.maml:para: Get download URLs
Get download URLs

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get download Urls

maml:description.maml:para: Get the IdentityCommand WebSession
Exports the WebSession object from the IdentityCommand module scope for use in other requests outside of the module scope.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Output the IdentityCommand WebSession object for the current authenticated session.

maml:description.maml:para: Get Identity tenant information
Get information for the Identity tenant

dev:remarks.maml:para: Output Identity tenant information

maml:description.maml:para: Get Tenant Cnames
Get Tenant Cnames

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get tenant Cnames

maml:description.maml:para: Get Identity tenant configuration
Get configuration data from the Identity tenant

dev:remarks.maml:para: Outputs tenant configuration data

maml:description.maml:para: Fetch details of cloud directory users
By default, returns details of all existing users in the cloud directory.
Specify `id` or `username` parameter to to fetch the details of a specific existing user in the cloud directory.
The username of the user to get details of
The id of the user to get details of
Specify to return details of authenticated user
Specify to return details of the Tech Support User
The username of the user to get details of
The id of the user to get details of
Specify to return details of authenticated user
Specify to return details of the Tech Support User

dev:remarks.maml:para: Return all users
Return user with matching id
Return user with matching username
Return details of current authenticated user
Return details of current authenticated user

maml:description.maml:para: List roles user is a member of.
Get a list of roles for a user. Returns user roles and administrative rights associated with the roles.
The ID of the user
The maximum number of results to return for the specified page.
The number of pages of results to return.
The number of entities to return per page.

Can be set to the following values: -1: returns live data but writes to the cache for query results. <-1: don't read from or write to the cache for query results. 0: use the cache for both read/write with 'caching in minutes' as TTL of the results.
Comma-separated list of column names to sort by.
The ID of the user
The maximum number of results to return for the specified page.
The number of pages of results to return.
The number of entities to return per page.

Can be set to the following values: -1: returns live data but writes to the cache for query results. <-1: don't read from or write to the cache for query results. 0: use the cache for both read/write with 'caching in minutes' as TTL of the results.
Comma-separated list of column names to sort by.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Return a list of roles for a matching user.

maml:description.maml:para: Cloud lock a user
Enable cloud lock for a specified user
The unique ID (Uuid) of the user to cloud lock.
The unique ID (Uuid) of the user to cloud lock.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set cloud lock status to true for user with matching id

maml:description.maml:para: Request authentication token using OAuth
Gets a CyberArk Identity Security Platform OIDC token based on grant type.
The URL of the CyberArk Identity tenant to authenticate to.
Credential object containing username and password of a service user that is an OAuth confidential client to authenticate to CyberArk Identity.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The URL of the CyberArk Identity tenant to authenticate to.
Credential object containing username and password of a service user that is an OAuth confidential client to authenticate to CyberArk Identity.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Initiates OAuth confidential client service user authentication to specified tenant

maml:description.maml:para: Authenticates a user to a CyberArk Identity tenant.
Use this command to authenticate to CyberArk Identity.
Allows a user to provide authentication details, and satisfy any required MFA challenges.
Currently supports all authentication mechanisms except U2F & DUO.
The URL of the CyberArk Identity tenant to authenticate to.
Credential object containing username and password required to authenticate to CyberArk Identity.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Credential object containing username and password required to authenticate to CyberArk Identity.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The URL of the CyberArk Identity tenant to authenticate to.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Cred = Get-Credential PS C:\> New-IDSession -tenant_url https://some.tenant.cyberark.cloud -Credential $Cred

dev:remarks.maml:para: Initiates authentication to specified tenant, and allows selection and answer of any required MFA challenges.

maml:description.maml:para: Suspend MFA for a User
Suspend MFA to exempt a user from MFA login for a specified amount of time.
The unique ID (Uuid) of the user to exempt from MFA
Amount of time to exempt the user from MFA (default=10 minutes)
The unique ID (Uuid) of the user to exempt from MFA
Amount of time to exempt the user from MFA (default=10 minutes)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Exempts user with id 2134 from MFA for 10 minutes (default timespan)
Exempts user with id 2134 from MFA for 2 minutes

maml:description.maml:para: Check if a user is cloud locked
Check if a user is cloud locked
The unique ID (Uuid) of the user to check cloud lock status
The unique ID (Uuid) of the user to check cloud lock status

dev:remarks.maml:para: Checks if user with ID 1234 is cloud locked

maml:description.maml:para: Cloud unlock a user
Disable cloud lock for a specified user
The unique ID (Uuid) of the user to cloud unlock
The unique ID (Uuid) of the user to cloud unlock

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set cloud lock status to false for user with matching id
